page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: The housing in our block is a mixture of ages and styles.In the countryside around Aldham you can see mostly cottages,some with thatched roofs and others with red tiles.Most of the walls are construted with brick although a few are plaster covered.The cottages with thatched roofs and plaster walls were usually built before 1800. Some of the houses we looked at were more regular in shape and design.They were Georgian brick houses built in the 1700's,as well as Victorian houses built in the late 1800's.Since 1920 many new houses have been built;most of them are semi-detached and on the edge of the town or on estates.They are usally built of brick and tile but some are concrete framed.
